title: How to determine a point so that none of the tangents pass through the circle equation x^2 + y^2 = 25 - Quora

response.answer_text: A point inside the circle (x2+y2≤25x2+y2≤25) will not be a part of a tangent line to the circle. A point on the circle (x2+y2=25x2+y2=25) will be the tangent point for one tangent line to the circle. A point outside the circle (x2+y2≥25x2+y2≥25) will be the intersection of two distinct tangent lines to the circle.

The circle is centered on the origin of the axis and has a radius of 5 units. Now as far as tangents go, No tangents to the circle can go through it, therefore any point outside the circle can do. Is that the answer you expected or is there something I missed?
